Optional: [foo] means that this argument can be ignored. Required: means that you must use this argument for the command to work. Many: or [foos...] means that you can specify more than one. If you wish you use an argument with more than one word, use "double quotes" to let the bot you know what you want. Can I get the Bot's Source Code? Currently we are not planning to Give out the source code of our bot. Where is the bot hosted? The bot is hosted at Oxide Hosting which is a provides discord bot hosting and many other services

docs.text: Basic Bot Setup Setting up the prefix I want the bot to respond when I use the prefix - to do that, I can type eb!set prefix - . Setting up all the channels eb!set role-logs <#channel> Sets the channel where Ecobot will log things such as role create, role delete, & role update. More on that later. eb!set welcome-channel <#channel> Decides where join messages go, more on that later. Setting up modlogs We can use the eb!set modlogs <#channel> command set the modlogs to the channel you have mentioned. Whenever a user is warn/kick/softbaned/baned the bot would send a message there Settings Join/Leave Logs First we will set the message sent to the previously set channel with: eb!set welcome-channel <#channel> posts a random message when a user joins the server. eb!set leave-channel <#channel> posts a message when a user leaves the server. eb!set join-role <@role> add the role the newly joining member. Note: Make sure bot has is placed above the role you want to give

docs.text: FAQ How do i Invite the bot Click on this link (This Requires Administor Perms for you to Invite the bot) Click on the server in which you want to add the bot and Click on continue. Click on Authorize and then complete the Captha. How do i know the bot prefix The Default prefix of the bot is eb! You can always mention the bot to know the prefix You can also mention the bot to use it as an prefix How do I create Tags? Start off by using eb!tag add <Name> <Response> simply because it guides you through the process and tries to tell you what went wrong if any. You can also use eb!help tag to know what else you can do with tags Why does the bot complain about requiring more permissions? I've given it manage roles already! The way discord decides if you can add a role or not is based on two things: Does the member adding the role have 'manage roles' Is the member trying to add the role higher in the role hierarchy than the role they're trying to add? Just assign the bot a role that is higher than highest role it has to assign, the role being hoisted does not have to have any special permissions. How do I get a message ID? Discord settings -> Appearance -> Developer mode How do I get the bot to announce new members joining? You can the eb!set welcome-channel <#channel> and the bot would post messages whenever a use joins Another bot has the same command and they both respond, what do I do? Currently, We dont have an command enable/disable system but you can change the prefix of the bot and use the new prefix What are Basic Permissions The bot basically requires the following permissions: - VIEW_CHANNELS - SEND_MESSAGES - EMBED_LINKS - ATTACH_FILES - ADD_REACTIONS - USE_EXTERNAL_EMOJIS - CONNECT - SPEAK
